intro: Gagea fistulosa subsp. decandolleana, commonly known as the mountain gagea, is a perennial bulbous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its clustered, narrow leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils and is adapted to cool, temperate climates. It is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance. The subspecies decandolleana is distinguished by its specific floral and vegetative features compared to other subspecies of Gagea fistulosa.
